Description: A tech lead is a technical expert who leads a team of developers and engineers in the development of software and technology products. They are responsible for overseeing the technical aspects of a project, ensuring that development standards and best practices are followed, and providing guidance to team members to ensure timely delivery of high-quality software products. A tech lead must have strong technical skills, as well as excellent leadership, communication, and problem-solving abilities. They work closely with the project manager and business stakeholders to ensure that the technical goals of the project are aligned with the overall business objectives.

Required.SkillDescription: Experience in leading technical teams and managing complex technical projects
Strong understanding of software architecture principles and experience in designing and implementing scalable, maintainable, and high-performance software systems
Expertise in at least one programming language, and the ability to learn new programming languages quickly
Experience in database management and the ability to design and optimize database systems
Experience in system integration, including the ability to integrate disparate systems and applications
Experience in cloud computing technologies, including the ability to design and implement cloud-based solutions
Experience in DevOps practices and the ability to design and manage continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) pipelines

Recommended.SkillDescription: Strong understanding of Agile and Scrum methodologies and experience in implementing and managing these practices
A bachelors or masters degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field
Experience in managing and leading technical teams, and the ability to mentor and coach team members
Knowledge of artificial intelligence (AI) techniques, such as machine learning, natural language processing, and computer vision, and the ability to apply these techniques to solve business problems
Experience in big data technologies, such as Hadoop, Spark, and NoSQL databases, and the ability to use these technologies to analyze and process large volumes of data
Knowledge of blockchain technology, including understanding of smart contracts and distributed ledgers, and experience in applying this technology to business problems
Knowledge of cybersecurity principles and the ability to identify and mitigate potential security risks associated with software and systems
Knowledge of Internet of Things (IoT) technologies, and the ability to design and implement IoT solutions
Experience in designing and implementing microservices architectures, and knowledge of tools and techniques for managing microservices
Experience in mobile development, including the ability to design and develop mobile applications for iOS and Android platforms
Experience in product management, including the ability to identify customer needs and translate them into product requirements
Experience in UX design, including user research, wireframing, and prototyping, and the ability to design user-centered interfaces and applications
Experience in data science techniques, such as machine learning, statistical analysis, and data mining, and the ability to apply these techniques to solve business problems
